AlarmUsedReaction.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

AlarmSystem.synopsis: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.
AlarmSystem.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start Game2. Debug book - go to region - goblin camp - start3. Walk across bridge towards goblin checkpoint4. Guard will let you through as true soul (roll amazing)5. Pass him and go up the structure on the right6. Use the wardrum

Guard004.synopsis: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.

AlarmVandalize_002.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

Trespassing.synopsis: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.
Trespassing.how_to_trigger: from crashsite:go to region - act 1 - goblin camp - startgo into sneak mode and in recon:goto -86, 344 / goto -88.827 16.173 354.811 / goto -88.432; 22.544; 354.479 / goto -92, 354get caught by guards

Backup002.synopsis: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)

Guard002.synopsis: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
Guard002.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -81.286; 16.115; 3514. Talk with Warrior Puce.

Worg_002.synopsis: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.

Guard005.synopsis: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.

Backup001.synopsis: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.

AlarmVandalize_003.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

Guard003.synopsis: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.

Guard001.synopsis:
All guards at the checkpoint point the player to the guard with this dialog. He is an evil, nasty character who has no reason to go easy on the player. Should ooze disdain. This is the first goblin we meet and their weasly, cruel, wicked nature should stand out.
The goblin will let a non-allied player in only if they smear worg shit on their face. Yuck.
Guard001.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -81.379; 16.292; 3564. Talk with Sentinel Olak

AlarmVandalize_001.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

TopCliffWarning.synopsis: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.

AlarmVandalize_004.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

Backup003.synopsis: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Very stoked about the Absolute.A little drunk. A hiccup or two wouldn't be out of place :)

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.synopsis:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.how_to_trigger: go to region - act 1 - goblin camp - startdebugbook - quest flags -  act 1 - goblin camp - checkpoint - call capturedgoblinsazza will run across bridge to checkpoint, follow her and dialog triggers automatically

AlarmVandalize_005.synopsis: The player used the alarm drum. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.

CliffWarning.synopsis: Goblin warns an intruder to leave

Worg_001.synopsis: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.

reasoning: The session 'AlarmSystem' activates the alarm which causes the first half of the camp to become hostile. This indicates that it should precede any session related to reactions to the alarm, like 'AlarmUsedReaction' and 'AlarmVandalize_*'.

The sessions 'AlarmUsedReaction', 'AlarmVandalize_001', 'AlarmVandalize_002', 'AlarmVandalize_003', 'AlarmVandalize_004', and 'AlarmVandalize_005' all share similar synopses about players using the alarm drum and the resulting reactions from the goblins. Therefore, they should follow 'AlarmSystem'.

The session 'ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin' occurs when the player has released a captured goblin. This session must come after the player has interacted with this captured goblin and should precede any potential dialogues with guards at the checkpoint.

The session 'Trespassing' involves the player entering an area and getting caught by guards, which could happen after engaging with any of the guards. This suggests it can come after any of the guard sessions, but it is not strictly dependent on a specific order.

Sessions 'Guard001', 'Guard002', 'Guard003', 'Guard004', 'Guard005', and 'Backup001', 'Backup002', 'Backup003' all describe interactions with goblin guards at the checkpoint. Since engaging with these guards can lead to tensions or altercations, they should be considered as potential precursors to tension-related sessions like 'Trespassing', but no strict order is required here.

AlarmUsedReaction_0.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_0.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction_27.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_27.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

AlarmUsedReaction_2.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_2.text: I let you in and you raise the alarm anyway? Hurts my feelings, that does.
AlarmUsedReaction_2.context: NodeContext: Mock hurt - he let you in and you've proved yourself unworthy immediately. Now he's going to kill you

AlarmUsedReaction_19.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_19.text: Backup's comin'. Reckon I'll tell 'em you were an intruder after all.

AlarmUsedReaction_3.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_3.text: Eh... drum's still workin' all right, True Soul.
AlarmUsedReaction_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Raising the alarm for the third and next timesNodeContext: Player has made a mistake but is respected. Goblin is deferential.

AlarmUsedReaction_9.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_9.text: Reckon the lads'll stay put this time.
AlarmUsedReaction_9.context: NodeContext: Still deferential but more and more convinced that you're actually stupid. Flat - humouring you.

AlarmUsedReaction_4.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_4.text: Sorry for this, but I tried warnin' you.
AlarmUsedReaction_4.context: NodeContext: He's speaking to his better - a drow, who he'd normally be subservient to. But he's secretly relishing the opportunity to take one on.

AlarmUsedReaction_7.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_7.text: Lovely rhythm, that. Pity the drum's for callin' in backup.
AlarmUsedReaction_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Starts dancing afterwardsNodeContext: You've sounded the alarm, but played a nice beat while doing it. The goblin is snidely warning you that NORMALLY you'd be killed for it, but he'll do you a favour and let you off the hook this time.

AlarmUsedReaction_5.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_5.text: Don't worry - seein' how you made us dance, I won't let 'em kill ya - this time.

AlarmUsedReaction_8.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_8.text: Careful, your lordness. That drum's for callin' backup.
AlarmUsedReaction_8.context: NodeContext: He's speaking to his 'better' - trying his best to delicately warn the player that they're about to call in a horde of angry goblins.

AlarmUsedReaction_25.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_25.text: I'll calm 'em down, seein' as it was a lovely rhythm. But, erh, don't do it again.

AlarmUsedReaction_16.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_16.text: A lovely rhythm, your lordness. Shame you just raised the alarm.
AlarmUsedReaction_16.context: NodeContext: He's speaking to his better - a drow, who he'd normally be subservient to. But he's secretly relishing the opportunity to take one on.

AlarmUsedReaction_21.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_21.text: Lovely beat, that - course you warned half the camp there's killin' to be done. Get 'em, lads!
AlarmUsedReaction_21.context: NodeContext: Derisive, can't believe you're this stupid

AlarmUsedReaction_13.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_13.text: Lovely beat, that, True Soul. Just lovely.
AlarmUsedReaction_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Using the alarm for the third and next timesNodeContext: Sort of detached - just humouring you at this point.

AlarmUsedReaction_23.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_23.text: Reckon the lads'll stay put this time.

AlarmUsedReaction_14.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_14.text: Still got it, True Soul! Must be all that practice you're doin', heh.
AlarmUsedReaction_14.context: NodeContext: Still cheerful and respectul, but a bit more forced this time. You've done this once before and he's growing tired of it, even if he can't say it.

AlarmUsedReaction_18.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_18.text: Oh look - backup's on its way. Again.
AlarmUsedReaction_18.context: NodeContext: Creeping annoyance, but masking it. He's already had to explain your mistake once and he knows they're going to be annoyed.

AlarmUsedReaction_15.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_15.text: Ah, your excelness, you weren't supposed to touch that.
AlarmUsedReaction_15.context: NodeContext: He's speaking to his better - a drow, who he'd normally be subservient to. But he's secretly relishing the opportunity to take one on.

AlarmUsedReaction_20.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_20.text: Sorry 'bout this, but rules is rules.

AlarmUsedReaction_17.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_17.text: Oi! Can't say you weren't warned, mate.
AlarmUsedReaction_17.context: InternalNodeContext: This node MUST be above other Not True Soul nodesNodeContext: Losing patience with you - he let you off the hook once and now he's going to attack

AlarmUsedReaction_22.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_22.text: Eh... beg pardon, True Soul, but that's the alarm. Not to worry, though - I'll handle the lads.
AlarmUsedReaction_22.context: NodeContext: Player has made a mistake but is respected. Goblin is deferential.

AlarmUsedReaction_1.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_1.text: Heh. No harm gettin' the buggers off their arses, eh?
AlarmUsedReaction_1.context: NodeContext: Sucking up, making a joke of it

AlarmUsedReaction_24.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_24.text: Ah, nice one, True Soul. Keepin' the lads on their toes.
AlarmUsedReaction_24.context: NodeContext: Player has made a mistake - again - but goblin remains deferential.

AlarmUsedReaction_11.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_11.text: Can't have 'em fallin' asleep now, can we?
AlarmUsedReaction_11.context: NodeContext: Making light of the situation to mask his annoyance

AlarmUsedReaction_12.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_12.text: A fine entrance, your drowship, but we got orders. Lads, intruder!
AlarmUsedReaction_12.context: NodeContext: He's speaking to his better - a drow, who he'd normally be subservient to. But he's secretly relishing the opportunity to take one on.

AlarmUsedReaction_6.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction_6.text: Hah! Lads, looks like this idiot just went and raised the alarm on theirselves!
AlarmUsedReaction_6.context: NodeContext: Derisive, can't believe you're this stupid

AlarmSystem_5.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_5.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

AlarmSystem_4.speaker: Player
AlarmSystem_4.text: Bang the drum with an open palm.

AlarmSystem_13.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_13.text: *If the goblins didn't hear you before, they certainly do now.*
AlarmSystem_13.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

AlarmSystem_14.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_14.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*
AlarmSystem_14.context: InternalNodeContext: The backup goblins are dead, can't react

AlarmSystem_18.speaker: Player
AlarmSystem_18.text: Imitate the beat of a popular goblin drinking anthem.

AlarmSystem_6.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_6.text: *From the far distance, you hear a blast of goblin voices.*

AlarmSystem_8.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_8.text: *If the goblins didn't hear you before, they certainly do now.*
AlarmSystem_8.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

AlarmSystem_12.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_12.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*

AlarmSystem_20.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_20.text: *If the goblins didn't hear you before, they certainly do now.*
AlarmSystem_20.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

AlarmSystem_3.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem_3.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*

Guard004_0.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004_0.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Guard004_1.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004_1.context: NodeContext: stalwart; not letting the player in.

Guard004_2.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004_2.context: InternalNodeContext: thinks player is priestNodeContext: deferential, with respect. thinks player is a True Soul

Guard004_3.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Gained access by poop smearingNodeContext: Level of disgust - player has shit on their face.

AlarmVandalize_002_0.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just destroyed the alarm drum.NodeContext: Initially sharp, but reining it in as we're a figure of authority.

AlarmVandalize_002_1.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_1.context: NodeContext: At a loss what do do but not wanting to confront you

AlarmVandalize_002_2.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin let us in and then saw us attacking the drumNodeContext: Growly anger

AlarmVandalize_002_7.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_7.context: NodeContext: Shouting to guards - signalling to attack you

AlarmVandalize_002_5.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_5.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, shouting to friends to attack you

AlarmVandalize_002_3.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just damaged the alarm drum.NodeContext: Worried, obsequious - you're a person in authority doing something you shouldn't.

AlarmVandalize_002_4.speaker: Warrior Puce
AlarmVandalize_002_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin saw a random person attacking the drumNodeContext: Catching you doing something you shouldn't be. Said with a growl, angry, about to fight.

Trespassing_8.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_8.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing_8.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing_2.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_2.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Trespassing_15.speaker: Player
Trespassing_15.text: Just out for a walk, as you do.

Trespassing_17.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_17.text: Through here? You must be funnin'. Lads - attack!

Trespassing_19.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_19.text: Then what you standin' here for? The True Souls're inside the temple!
Trespassing_19.context: NodeContext: Impatient at your stupidity, ordering you to move

Trespassing_12.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_12.text: Go on, hop to! Ain't a one o' them I'd like to keep waiting.
Trespassing_12.context: NodeContext: Impatient, urging you on. Relishing the trouble you're about to be in for keeping their bosses waiting.

Trespassing_0.speaker: Player
Trespassing_0.text: Or you could let me pass, and live to see nightfall.

Trespassing_24.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_24.text: You? Well. In you get, then. Hope you brought somethin' good to chug.
Trespassing_24.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving. Disappointed he won't get to kill something.

Trespassing_14.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_14.text: You? Like crank you did. Lads - attack!

Trespassing_4.speaker: Player
Trespassing_4.text: I'm in a hurry. I have an important message from your boss.

Trespassing_16.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_16.text: Like crank you do. Lads - attack!

Trespassing_23.speaker: Player
Trespassing_23.text: Remove yourself from my presence, or pay the price.

Trespassing_30.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_30.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Trespassing_27.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_27.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Trespassing_31.speaker: Player
Trespassing_31.text: Stand down. I'll go where I please.

Trespassing_26.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_26.text: I-I-I didn't realise. Very sorry, your grace. Very sorry.
Trespassing_26.context: NodeContext: Suddenly terrified of having spoken out to a superior

Trespassing_11.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_11.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Trespassing_22.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_22.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Trespassing_13.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_13.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Trespassing_5.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_5.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Trespassing_36.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_36.context: NodeContext: Pleading and deferential. BArely escaped player's wrath

Trespassing_9.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_9.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Trespassing_28.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_28.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Trespassing_25.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_25.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Trespassing_7.speaker: Player
Trespassing_7.text: Stand down. I'll go where I please.

Trespassing_18.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_18.text: What're you at? Lads - this'n's trying to scramble me head!
Trespassing_18.context: NodeContext: Leading to combat - fury in his voice.

Trespassing_10.speaker: GROUP_GOB_Checkpoint_Guards
Trespassing_10.text: You again? That's enough creepin' around. Lads - attack!

Backup002_17.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_17.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002_2.speaker: Player
Backup002_2.text: Sounds like a bloody scrap. Where did you see that?

Backup002_1.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_1.text: You ain't hear? We sacked Waukeen's Rest and left it to burn.

Backup002_7.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_7.text: Drow flingin' magic, gnolls snappin' off heads. Inn's nothin' but a pile of ash by now.

Backup002_5.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_5.text: The Fist? Merc pigs from Baldur's Gate. Good for one thing: feedin' to worgs.

Backup002_14.speaker: Player
Backup002_14.text: You saw a Flaming Fist? Where?

Backup002_9.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_9.text: Buncha prisoners got towed to Moonrise. City snobs, mostly.

Backup002_0.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_0.text: But the Flamin' Fist? Pile of smokin' corpses.

Backup002_18.speaker: Player
Backup002_18.text: Do you happen to know the way to Moonrise?

Backup002_12.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_12.text: You ain't know the broken road? Heh!

Backup002_8.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_8.text: Take the north path. It winds ya 'round, sure as sunshine, 'til you reach the Towers.

Backup002_16.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_16.text: I'll tell ya real slow-like so ya don't miss it:

Backup002_10.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002_10.context: NodeContext: Said real slow like the stupid goblin thinks you're the one that's stupid.

Guard002_0.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002_0.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Guard002_1.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002_1.context: NodeContext: Gruff - you haven't been granted permission to enter.

Guard002_2.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002_2.context:
InternalNodeContext: Gained access by poop smearingNodeContext: pronounce like 'dung-er' with a hard g, the word 'dung'. Referring to the player smear
ing poop on their face

Guard002_3.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002_3.context: InternalNodeContext: thinks player is priestNodeContext: deferential, thinks player is a True Soul

Worg_002_0.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002_0.text: Good smell. Pack smell. Smell like papa. Papa?
Worg_002_0.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the shit on your face. Quick, primal - as if looking for comfort.

Worg_002_1.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002_1.text: Touch me 'n I'll bleed ye out.
Worg_002_1.context: NodeContext: A seething whisper. Used to being mistreated

Guard005_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005_0.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Backup001_4.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_4.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001_3.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_3.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

Backup001_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).NodeContext: Elated. Player has confirmed they're from the same clan. She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).

Backup001_7.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: She turns away from you with a huff.NodeContext: She's very put off. Player has confirmed they are NOT part of the same clan. She turns away with a huff.

Backup001_9.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_9.context: NodeContext: Lost her friends. Doesn't knwo where they went. Scared.

Backup001_10.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001_10.context: NodeContext: She's very put off. Player has confirmed they are NOT part of the same clan. She turns away with a huff.

AlarmVandalize_003_0.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_0.text: 'Scuse me, your worshipness, but we need that.
AlarmVandalize_003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just damaged the alarm drum.NodeContext: Worried, obsequious - you're a person in authority doing something you shouldn't.

AlarmVandalize_003_4.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_4.text: We use it to call the others if trouble starts.

AlarmVandalize_003_3.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin saw a random person attacking the drumNodeContext: Catching you doing something you shouldn't be

AlarmVandalize_003_2.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_2.text: Looks like someone likes messin' around, lads!
AlarmVandalize_003_2.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, shouting to friends to attack you

AlarmVandalize_003_6.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just destroyed the alarm drum.NodeContext: Initially sharp, but reining it in as we're a figure of authority.

AlarmVandalize_003_1.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_1.text: That is... I'm sure you have your reasons, your worshipness.

AlarmVandalize_003_7.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin let us in and then saw us attacking the drumNodeContext: Affronted. Ranga = RANG-a (means non-goblin)

AlarmVandalize_003_5.speaker: Tracker Bal
AlarmVandalize_003_5.text: After we let you past and everything. Get 'em, lads!
AlarmVandalize_003_5.context: NodeContext: Disgust with you. Shouting to guards - signalling to attack you

Guard003_0.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Guard003_1.context: InternalNodeContext: thinks player is priestNodeContext: deferential, thinks player is a True Soul

Guard003_2.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Gained access by poop smearingNodeContext: In contrast with 'good-reek'

Guard001_3.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, underdark (not drow)NodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001_1.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_1.text: Only funnin'. Got word from Moonrise?
Guard001_1.context: NodeContext: Player is an ally to goblins. Goblin is still unpleasant but is relatively friendly toward player.

Guard001_39.speaker: Gale
Guard001_39.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001_120.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_120.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Guard001_15.speaker: Player
Guard001_15.text: My message is for whoever's in charge - not you.

Guard001_147.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_147.text: Right. Dror Ragzlin's inside, in through the temple.

Guard001_179.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_179.text: Don't know Dror Ragzlin's name? Bit odd, don't you think, lads?
Guard001_179.context: NodeContext: Player tried to deceive goblin. Goblin doesn't WANT to fight player, but is performing guard duty after all.

Guard001_215.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_215.text: Where you goin'? Camp's that way, idiot.

Guard001_123.speaker: Player
Guard001_123.text: Attack him. This is a waste of time.

Guard001_154.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_154.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001_107.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_107.text: Of course! 'Scusin' me; didn't know who you was.
Guard001_107.context: NodeContext: Goblin realizing Player is a superior to him. HAs a reaction of fear and deference.

Guard001_220.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_220.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Guard001_54.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_54.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Guard001_31.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_31.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Guard001_115.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_115.text: Stand down, lads! We got a True Soul comin' through!

Guard001_182.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_182.context: NodeContext: Player is a superior to the goblin, and the goblin knows it. He is deferential.

Guard001_130.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_130.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Guard001_155.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_155.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Guard001_127.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_127.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Guard001_168.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_168.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Guard001_125.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_125.context: NodeContext: He senses me trying to control his mind, but I've failed. He's semi-confused but mostly angry.

Guard001_172.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_172.text: Lads! This'n's trying to scramble my brains!
Guard001_172.context: NodeContext: I failed at controlling his mind. He and his fellow guards go hostile at this point.

Guard001_159.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_159.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Guard001_8.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_8.context: InternalNodeContext: after we met the guard and got the accessNodeContext: Unfriendly. We got access, but guard isn't particularly happy to see us.

Guard001_40.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_40.text: I don't want trouble - learned my lesson. Can still taste it on me gums...
Guard001_40.context: InternalNodeContext: This hasmet greeting if the player successfully intimidated Olak into eating dung.

Guard001_47.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_47.context: InternalNodeContext: we met the guards, but didn't get the access. Fallback node.NodeContext: player already failed once to gain access to camp. Goblin is in no mood to deal with player again.

Guard001_59.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_59.text: Shove over, Klaw! Drow comin' through.
Guard001_59.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001_71.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_71.context: InternalNodeContext: after we met the guard and got the accessNodeContext: Deferential. Player used psyonics on the goblin, goblin respects player

Guard001_88.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_88.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, drowNodeContext: Showing deference to player, who's a drow. But goblins are not used to showing deference and Olak gets it wrong.

Guard001_131.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_131.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, not drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001_110.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_110.text: Unless you got another reason to be here, feck-shite.
Guard001_110.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Dripping with disdain.

Guard001_196.speaker: Gale
Guard001_196.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001_94.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_94.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Guard001_33.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_33.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001_22.speaker: Player
Guard001_22.text: I'm looking for someone named Halsin.

Guard001_144.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_144.text: Good for you, mate. Now get out of my sight before my worg rips you a new hole.

Guard001_139.speaker: Player
Guard001_139.text: I'm a messenger - here to see Minthara.

Guard001_37.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_37.text: Ah, right! Beg pardon - gotta give all visitors the ol' squinty eye, y'know?
Guard001_37.context: NodeContext: He's just discovered that we're important, and is trying to make up for being rude to us. Nervous, hoping there won't be repercussions

Guard001_90.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_90.text: Go on in and have a drink for me, eh?

Guard001_206.speaker: Player
Guard001_206.text: Have you seen a druid named Halsin?

Guard001_95.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_95.text: Go on in and have a drink for me, eh?

Guard001_205.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_205.context: NodeContext: I've succeeded in controlling his mind. He's confused but positive.

Guard001_30.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_30.context: NodeContext: Didn't realize you were important. He's embarrassed, blames his worg. Gets angry at her, boots the worg in the chest and turned to his comrades.*

Guard001_27.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_27.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Guard001_133.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_133.text: Easy, lads! We got a True Soul comin' through!
Guard001_133.context: NodeContext: Full of deference to you.

Guard001_164.speaker: Player
Guard001_164.text: Tell me, what can I expect inside?

Guard001_45.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_45.text: Lads're celebrating the raid on Waukeen's Rest. Captured a duke, we did! All the way from the city.

Guard001_191.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_191.text: I'm sure the higher-ups'll make sure you get the best of the spoils, your excelness. The boss is in the temple inside. Minthara, too. A-and Priestess Gut can show you how many new recruits we got!
Guard001_191.context: InternalNodeContext: Player now knows 3 goblin leaders.

Guard001_214.speaker: Player
Guard001_214.text: I hear wearing the local 'war colours' is the price of entry.

Guard001_149.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_149.text: Heh. Just a bit of fun.

Guard001_186.speaker: Player
Guard001_186.text: Fun indeed. Why don't you get in on it?

Guard001_122.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_122.text: True Soul, I don't think... I...

Guard001_64.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak takes dung and smears it on her own face.

Guard001_53.speaker: Player
Guard001_53.text: I don't find it particularly funny. So you'll stop.

Guard001_221.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_221.text: Y-yes, True Soul. I promise. Never again.

Guard001_211.speaker: Player
Guard001_211.text: Hah! An excellent remedy for a boring afternoon.

Guard001_104.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_104.text: Hear, hear, my good True Soul!

Guard001_78.speaker: Player
Guard001_78.text: I'm looking for a druid named Halsin. Where is he?

Guard001_34.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_34.text: Don't know any Halsin, your excelness.

Guard001_21.speaker: Player
Guard001_21.text: I heard he was captured breaking into this very camp.

Guard001_62.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_62.text: Oh, one of them thieves? If he ain't dead, he's in the pits with the rest of 'em.

Guard001_82.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_82.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Guard001_165.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_165.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Guard001_224.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_224.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Guard001_118.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_118.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Guard001_136.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_136.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Guard001_91.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_91.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Guard001_19.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_19.context: NodeContext: He senses me trying to control his mind, but I've failed. He's semi-confused but mostly angry.

Guard001_166.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_166.text: Lads! This'n's trying to scramble my brains!
Guard001_166.context: NodeContext: I failed at controlling his mind. He and his fellow guards go hostile at this point.

Guard001_119.speaker: Player
Guard001_119.text: To offer my sword to your boss. You can be my first demonstration, if you like.

Guard001_103.speaker: Player
Guard001_103.text: I'm a hired sword - employer's inside. Stand aside. Now.

Guard001_97.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_97.context: NodeContext: Blames worg for his bad attitude.The goblin kicks at the worg and turns to her comrades.*

Guard001_76.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_76.text: She's a little overexcited. Been a busy day. Lads're celebratin'.
Guard001_76.context: NodeContext: Ingratiating self to player. Talking about worg, hoping to escape player's wrath.

Guard001_126.speaker: Player
Guard001_126.text: I could best all of your sentinels with my bare hands. Let me pass.

Guard001_129.speaker: Player
Guard001_129.text: Beautiful animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001_26.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_26.context: NodeContext: He's impressed. He's a worg expert so your knowledge appeals to him, but he doesn't want to make it too easy for you.

Guard001_153.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_153.text: Dumb as a rock, but world class at tearin' the throats outta wee ones, she is.
Guard001_153.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001_111.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_111.text: Rest of her litter's inside, in the pens. Beautiful beasts.
Guard001_111.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001_92.speaker: Player
Guard001_92.text: I've never seen a pack up close - always wanted to.

Guard001_178.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_178.text: Be a shame if you came all this way without havin' a look. But I can't let you pass just like that.

Guard001_195.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_195.text: Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001_195.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001_171.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_171.text: Nice dab o' this across the mug oughta do it.
Guard001_171.context: CinematicNodeContext: *He pointed to a steaming pile of worg dung at his feet.*NodeContext: Pointing to worg shit as he says this. Stifling an evil laugh. He's told the player to smear shit in their face.

Guard001_18.speaker: Player
Guard001_18.text: Why not. Got any designs in mind?

Guard001_32.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_32.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to smear shit on their face. He's full of delight, stifling his laughter.

Guard001_84.speaker: Player
Guard001_84.text: Should've just let me pass. Now you're going to eat worg turds.

Guard001_0.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_0.context: NodeContext: Laughes at the start, but quickly sobers up as he realises the player is serious (eat worg dung)

Guard001_209.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_209.text: Nah, you're all hot air. Nice bit of war paint'll put you in your place.
Guard001_209.context: NodeContext: Rallying, trying to stand up to the barbaria player/.

Guard001_72.speaker: Player
Guard001_72.text: Scoop up the warm dung and fling it at Olak's face.

Guard001_207.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_207.text: Hey! Watch it, you daft ranga!
Guard001_207.context: NodeContext: Player threw dung at Olak but missed. He's pissed. Hard 'g' in 'ranga'

Guard001_142.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_142.context: NodeContext: Gleefully enjoying your misery; he's asking you to smear shit on your face.

Guard001_17.speaker: Player
Guard001_17.text: Grimace and do what you have to do.

Guard001_42.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_42.text: HA! Hahaha! I can't believe you did it! You stupid idiot!
Guard001_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's laughing, gleeful at my miseryNodeContext: I did as he asked and smeared shit on my face. He's gleeful at humiliating me.

Guard001_132.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_132.text: Go on, mate. Enjoy the festivities. You earned it!
Guard001_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's laughing, gleeful at my misery, said with faux sincerityNodeContext: SAid between laughter. I humiliated myself for his pleasure so he's happy enough.

Guard001_70.speaker: Player
Guard001_70.text: I'm looking for someone named Halsin.

Guard001_80.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_80.text: Who? If he ain't one of us, and if he's here, he's down in the pits.

Guard001_161.speaker: Lae'zel
Guard001_161.text: Save the druid if you must. If we spill goblin blood on the way, all the better.

Guard001_187.speaker: Gale
Guard001_187.text: 'Down in the pits', no less. Sounds ominous among creatures that love bloodsports. Better step to it.

Guard001_28.speaker: Karlach
Guard001_28.text: Sounds rancid. Let's see if we can get him out of there.

Guard001_87.speaker: Astarion
Guard001_87.text: If this is the state of their camp, how bad must 'the pits' be?

Guard001_184.speaker: Wyll
Guard001_184.text: 'Down in the pits'? Either Halsin's in a foul mood, or he awaits rescue. Likely both.

Guard001_73.speaker: Shadowheart
Guard001_73.text: 'The pits'...? He couldn't be somewhere pleasant-sounding, could he? Better still be alive.

Guard001_10.speaker: Player
Guard001_10.text: Sounds festive in there. I do enjoy a party.

Guard001_194.speaker: Player
Guard001_194.text: That noise coming from behind you: good or bad?

Guard001_116.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_116.text: We're celebratin' a raid. No better time in camp than this.

Guard001_98.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_98.text: Get yourself a bit of fun before it dries up.

Guard001_192.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_192.text: Ripped the guts outta Waukeen's Rest, we did. Inns are good fer guttin'.

Guard001_173.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_173.text: Lads even captured some duke. Worth celebratin', that is.

Guard001_41.speaker: Player
Guard001_41.text: Smear the dung across your face. It's not your first time.

Guard001_83.speaker: Player
Guard001_83.text: Wink, gather the dung, and fling it at all four guards.

Guard001_216.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_216.text: Blech! Hope that was worth it, deadie.
Guard001_216.context: NodeContext: I just threw shit at him. This should be an emotional, furious response. He's about to attack.

Guard001_29.speaker: Player
Guard001_29.text: That's nature's bounty. Helps the trees grow. Eat it, or else.

Guard001_143.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_143.text: A-all right! All right! Calm down, I'll do it... just give me a moment to... ugh...
Guard001_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering. Glances down towards worg dung on the ground on 'ugh', then reluctantly crouches down.NodeContext: Cowed. Knows he's going to have to eat worg dung to avoid a fight

Guard001_101.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_101.text: Absolute preserve me... offh... UGGH - it's still warm... hurrph!
Guard001_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak is crouched down while the player observes. He retches and gags as he's forced to eat worg dung out of frame. The player and companions react.NodeContext: Gagging and retching as he's forced to eat worg dung

Guard001_16.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_16.text: Bleeugh. It's gone. Are we done...?
Guard001_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Straightens up and wipes his mouth with the back of his handNodeContext: Disgusted, half-pleading.

Guard001_67.speaker: Player
Guard001_67.text: I'm looking for someone named Halsin.

Guard001_210.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_210.text: Hal-who? Dunno, might be he's the prisoner down in the pits.
Guard001_210.context: NodeContext: Lost some bluster. Now just answering questions in the hope the player will move on

Guard001_89.speaker: Player
Guard001_89.text: Sounds festive in there. I do enjoy a party.

Guard001_160.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_160.text: Goblin parties ain't for everyone... but I reckon you'll manage.
Guard001_160.context: NodeContext: Lost some bluster. Now just answering questions in the hope the player will move on

Guard001_141.speaker: Player
Guard001_141.text: That noise coming from behind you: good or bad?

Guard001_113.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_113.context: NodeContext: Lost some bluster. Now just answering questions in the hope the player will move on

Guard001_24.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_24.text: We're celebratin' a raid. Set Waukeen's Rest ablaze - caught ourselves a duke an' all.
Guard001_24.context: NodeContext: Lost some bluster. Now just answering questions in the hope the player will move on

Guard001_193.speaker: Player
Guard001_193.text: Unless you want seconds, we're done here.

Guard001_44.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_44.text: No! No more for me. On you go.
Guard001_44.context: NodeContext: Lost some bluster. Now just answering questions in the hope the player will move on

Guard001_175.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_175.text: Them's the rules. You follow 'em now or you follow 'em dead. What'll it be?
Guard001_175.context: NodeContext: I refused to do what he asked. He's not amused. Icy, savage.

Guard001_49.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_49.text: Do it or don't, you bloody ranga!
Guard001_49.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' in 'ranga'. I'm waveirng on whether I'll follow his commands. He's not amused.

Guard001_176.speaker: Player
Guard001_176.text: I think I'm just going to leave.

Guard001_4.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_4.text: Don't remember sayin' that was an option.

Guard001_167.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_167.text: Your mug'll look right lovely stuck on a pike. But we'll do it up nice.

Guard001_61.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_61.context: InternalNodeContext: Can flinging dung at Olek make him go blind for combat?NodeContext: Player threw dung in Olak's eyes. This leads to combat.

Guard001_79.speaker: Player
Guard001_79.text: She looks fierce. Is she battle-tested?

Guard001_181.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_181.text: 'Course. Ripped out three bellies on our last raid alone.

Guard001_157.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_157.text: Hold it! You're not going anywhere. Not 'til you tell me why you're sniffin' around.

Guard001_134.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_134.context: NodeContext: Goblin isn't impressed by your attempt to use fancy words in front of him. He's about to fight you.

Guard001_188.speaker: Player
Guard001_188.text: Glossy coat on that animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001_202.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_202.context: NodeContext: He's suspicious but credulous. Nervous voice

Guard001_217.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_217.text: Well. Guess we're in with all sorts these days.
Guard001_217.context: NodeContext: He disdainfully accepts that you're allies.

Guard001_145.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_145.text: If you're 'ere to see Dror Ragzlin, you'll wanna let 'im and the lads know you're one of us.

Guard001_124.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_124.text: There's a party on. Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001_124.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001_65.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_65.context: NodeContext: He's suspicious but credulous. Nervous voice

Guard001_106.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_106.text: This better not be Minthara's messenger. If the boss finds out I gave them a hard time, that's me done.

Guard001_213.speaker: Narrator
Guard001_213.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Guard001_223.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001_223.context: InternalNodeContext: after we met the guard and got the accessNodeContext: Player has shit on their face, goblin is mocking them here.

AlarmVandalize_001_2.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_2.text: Oi! What you doin' with the alarm?
AlarmVandalize_001_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin saw a random person attacking the drumNodeContext: Catching you doing something you shouldn't be

AlarmVandalize_001_5.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_5.text: Looks like this idiot's after a kickin', lads!
AlarmVandalize_001_5.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, shouting to friends to attack you

AlarmVandalize_001_3.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_3.text: We let you in, and you go trashin' our stuff? Just bad manners, that.
AlarmVandalize_001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin let us in and then saw us attacking the drumNodeContext: Mock disgust, disappointment

AlarmVandalize_001_7.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_7.text: Can't abide bad manners, can we lads?
AlarmVandalize_001_7.context: NodeContext: Shouting to guards - signalling to attack you

AlarmVandalize_001_4.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_4.text: Beg pardon True Soul, but that's for callin' on the lads if we need 'em.
AlarmVandalize_001_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just damaged the alarm drum.NodeContext: Worried, obsequious - you're a person in authority doing something you shouldn't.

AlarmVandalize_001_0.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_0.text: Might, eh... might be best if you left it alone. Beggin' pardon.

AlarmVandalize_001_6.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just destroyed the alarm drum.NodeContext: Initially sharp, but reining it in as we're a figure of authority.

AlarmVandalize_001_1.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmVandalize_001_1.text: Ah... no worries, True Soul. If we need the lads we'll just... holler, I s'pose.

AlarmVandalize_004_0.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just destroyed the alarm drum.NodeContext: Initially sharp, but reining it in as we're a figure of authority.

AlarmVandalize_004_7.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_7.text: Ah... no worries, True Soul. If we need the lads we'll just... holler, I s'pose.
AlarmVandalize_004_7.context: NodeContext: hesitant, confused - addressing an authority figure who just destroyed an alarm, and he's not sure why they did it but trying not to offend

AlarmVandalize_004_1.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_1.text: We let you in and you go trashin' our stuff? Just bad manners, that.
AlarmVandalize_004_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin let us in and then saw us attacking the drumNodeContext: Mock disgust, disappointment

AlarmVandalize_004_2.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_2.text: Can't abide bad manners, can we lads?
AlarmVandalize_004_2.context: NodeContext: Shouting to guards - signalling to attack you

AlarmVandalize_004_3.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_3.text: Beg pardon, True Soul, but that's for callin' on the lads if we need 'em.
AlarmVandalize_004_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just damaged the alarm drum.NodeContext: Worried, obsequious - you're a person in authority doing something you shouldn't.

AlarmVandalize_004_6.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_6.text: Might, eh... might be best if you left it alone.

AlarmVandalize_004_5.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_5.text: Oi! What you doin' with the alarm?
AlarmVandalize_004_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin saw a random person attacking the drumNodeContext: Catching you doing something you shouldn't be

AlarmVandalize_004_4.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AlarmVandalize_004_4.text: Looks like this idiot's after a kickin', lads!
AlarmVandalize_004_4.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, shouting to friends to attack you

Backup003_0.speaker: Warlock Tud
Backup003_0.text: Lookin' at a future True Soul, you are. Boss Ragzlin says I'm next in line!

Backup003_2.speaker: Wyll
Backup003_2.text: Boss Ragzlin, eh? Must be the goblin in charge.
Backup003_2.context: NodeContext: Wyll overheard gpoblin mention Ragzlin, pronounced "RAGS-lin." That means his target is close.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_15.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_15.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_15.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_10.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_10.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_10.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_18.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_18.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_18.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_26.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_26.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_26.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_24.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_24.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_12.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_12.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_12.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_7.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_7.text: Go on. I ain't gonna hold up a drow.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_22.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_22.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow True Soul know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_22.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_34.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_31.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_31.text: Is it true, what Saz says? You helped her escape that grove?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_31.context: NodeContext: To player. Genuine inquiry, but he's disinclined to believe you.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_6.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_6.text: Yes - I don't believe in keeping prisoners.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_28.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_28.text: Heh. Then behave while you're inside. Our people don't mind it one bit.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_28.context: NodeContext: i.e. 'our people don't mind putting people in cages'. He's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_13.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_13.text: Behave yourself. Saz's vouchin' for you. You mess up, you and Saz'll get it.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_13.context: NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_4.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_4.text: Quiet type, eh? Good. Keep outta trouble, or you and Saz'll get it.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_4.context: NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_5.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_5.context: NodeContext: Sazza to Olak. 'Shut up and let us in.'

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_27.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_27.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_27.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_37.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_37.text: I'm only keeping her around in case I get hungry.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_11.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_11.text: My reasons are of no concern to you.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_0.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_0.text: True enough. I couldn't resist her charming company.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_3.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_3.text: I just hate seeing animals in cages.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_20.speaker: Player
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_20.text: It was a daring escape. Slew thirteen druids bare-handed, Sazza and I.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_33.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_33.text: Hah! A ranga and Sazza killing druids? Pull the other one.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_29.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_29.text: Go on ahead. Already met your little friend. Two of you can go celebrate together.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_35.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_35.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_35.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_14.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_14.text: I ain't gonna hold up a True Soul.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_1.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_1.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_1.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_36.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_36.text: How'd a rat like you get in with a True Soul?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin_36.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

AlarmVandalize_005_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_1.text: Oi! What you doin' with the alarm?
AlarmVandalize_005_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin saw a random person attacking the drumNodeContext: Catching you doing something you shouldn't be

AlarmVandalize_005_3.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_3.text: Looks like this idiot's after a kickin', lads!
AlarmVandalize_005_3.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, shouting to friends to attack you

AlarmVandalize_005_2.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_2.text: Beg pardon True Soul, but that's for callin' on the lads if we need 'em.
AlarmVandalize_005_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just damaged the alarm drum.NodeContext: Worried, obsequious - you're a person in authority doing something you shouldn't.

AlarmVandalize_005_7.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_7.text: Might, eh... might be best if you left it alone. Beggin' pardon.

AlarmVandalize_005_5.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin thinks we are a True Soul. And we just destroyed the alarm drum.NodeContext: Initially sharp, but reining it in as we're a figure of authority.

AlarmVandalize_005_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_0.text: Ah... no worries, True Soul. If we need the lads we'll just... holler, I spose.

AlarmVandalize_005_6.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_6.text: We let you in and you go trashin' our stuff? Just bad manners, that.
AlarmVandalize_005_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin let us in and then saw us attacking the drumNodeContext: Mock disgust, disappointment

AlarmVandalize_005_4.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
AlarmVandalize_005_4.text: Can't abide bad manners, can we lads?
AlarmVandalize_005_4.context: NodeContext: Shouting to guards - signalling to attack you

CliffWarning_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning_0.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning_0.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Worg_001_0.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001_0.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001_0.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

Worg_001_1.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001_1.text: Rip ya. Rip ya fer yer giblets. Got thick giblets. Want 'em.
Worg_001_1.context: NodeContext: Slavering worg, hungry, vicious. Spoken quickly.
